title: Introduction to Glaciers
description: In this lesson students will be introduced to the glaciers of Alberta, glacier terminology, meet a glaciologist from the University of Alberta and identify the effects of human activity on glaciers.

files.title: Glaciers in Alberta
files.description: A slide show about glaciers in Alberta.

tags: Energy and Matter in the Biosphere
learningOutcomes: develop an understanding of what glaciologist do
identify glacier location in Alberta
be introduced to glacier vocabulary
learn what Dr. Ali Criscitiello does at the Ice Core Lab
identify the effects of human activity on glaciers

relatedUrls.title: U of A Ice Core Lab

title: Love it or Lose It: Alberta Glacier Edition
description: Students investigate the location of glaciers in Alberta and observe how they have changed over time. Students learn about how climate change is affecting our glaciers and come up with an action plan to help prevent the further loss of our glaciers.

files.title: Love it or Lose it: Alberta Glacier Edition

learningOutcomes: identify glacier location in Alberta
observe change in the glaciers over time
Investigate how climate change is affecting the Albertaâ€™s Glaciers
be challenged to develop an action plan of how they can help prevent further loss of the glaciers

title: Ice Core Basics
description: The students will watch videos of a glaciologist talking about how she analyzes the ice cores she collects from glaciers.

files.title: Ice Core Basics

tags: Energy and Matter in Chemical Change
Energy and Matter in the Biosphere
learningOutcomes: understand what we can learn from ice core analysis

title: Follow the Flow: Water Quality and the Columbia Icefield
description: Students will learn what a watershed is and identify what watershed they live within. Through watching some short video interviews students will understand how climate change is resulting in persistent chemicals, some banned in Canada, are being released into the rivers from which we get our drinking water from.

files.title: Follow the Flow

learningOutcomes: identify their watershed and drainage basin
find the Columbia Icefield on the map
define persistent chemicals
investigate factors that contribute to water quality
develop an understanding of how climate change will affect the quality and of our drinking water

title: Water Test Procedures
description: Water test procedures guide.

files.title: Water Test Procedures

title: 360 Virtual Field Trips to Alberta's 6 Ecoregions
description: In this scavenger hunt lesson, students will learn about what makes each of Alberta's 6 ecoregions uniqueâ€”identifying icons for geography, geology, soils, landforms, climate, plants, animals, natural resource use and interesting facts (including species at risk).

files.title: Alberta's Ecoregions - 360 Virtual Field Trips Lesson Plan
360 Virtual Tours Scavenger Hunt Student Worksheet
Scavenger Hunt Sheet
360 Virtual Tours Scavenger Hunt - Fillable Google Slides
Scavenger Hunt Sheet - Fillable Google Slides

tags: Energy and Flow in Global Systems
learningOutcomes: students will demonstrate an understanding and appreciation of how geography, climate, soils, geology, plants and animals define a natural ecoregion
Students will identify species and risk in each ecoregion

title: Animal Adpatations - Using the 360 Virtual Field Trips
description: In this lesson students will explore animals in all 6 ecoregions within Alberta and learn about how they are specially adapted to living there.

files.title: Grade 3 Science Adaptations and the 360 Virtual Field Trips
Animal Adaptations Student Worksheet - Fillable Google Slides

learningOutcomes: Students will learn how animals are adapted to life in each of the 6 natural regions of Alberta

title: Plant and Animal Adaptations - Using the 360 Virtual Field Trips
description: In this lesson students will explore the plants and animals in all 6 ecoregions within Alberta, learn how they are specially adapted to living there, what human activities affect their survival and which species are at risk in each ecoregion.

files.title: Grade 9 Science Adaptations and the 360 Virtual Field Trips
Grade 9 Plant and Animal Adaptations Student Worksheet - Fillable Google Slides

learningOutcomes: students will describe how plants and animals are adapted to life in each natural ecoregion of Alberta
Students will identify risks to species survival in each ecoregion
Students will identify species at risk in each region

title: Going Going Going Gone: Climate Change and the Columbia Icefield
description: Students will explore how climate change has affected Alberta's glaciers and do some calculations to determine the loss of ice on the Athabasca Glacier.

files.title: Going Going Going Gone

learningOutcomes: understand seasonal variation in glacier mass
understand the effect of climate change on glacier mass
calculate loss of glacier ice on the Athabasca Glacier over the next 10 years
determine the loss of ice volume in Rocky Mountain Glaciers

title: Climate Change in Alberta: Investigating Mild, Medium and Hot Climate Scenarios
description: Students will use the Alberta Tomorrow simulator to investigate different climate change scenarios and see the consequences of different futures and the benefits of using beneficial management practices.

files.title: Climate Change in Alberta: Using the Alberta Tomorrow Simulator

tags: Energy and Matter in Chemical Change
Energy and Matter Exchange in the Biosphere
learningOutcomes: Investigate the impact of climate change on Albertaâ€™s precipitation, climate
Investigate the impact of climate change on Albertaâ€™s natural regions
Investigate the impact of climate change on our environment and economy

title: Water Quality, Climate Change and Alberta's Glaciers
description: This lesson plan accompanies the webinar recording found under the video section. The webinar was held on May 27, 2020 and features four prominent scientists discussing climate change, glacier melt, water policy, and water quality in Alberta.

files.title: Water Quality, Climate Change and Albertaâ€™s Glaciers
Webinar Worksheet
Glaciers in Alberta (Google Slides)

learningOutcomes: learn about water quality in Alberta
identify what watershed you live within
understand basic glacier terminology
describe the effect of climate change on Albertaâ€™s glaciers
be introduced to the impact of forest fires on glaciers
become aware of the importance of water policy in dealing with the effects of climate change
consider the impact of our activities on climate change and Albertaâ€™s glaciers

title: Where is my Home? Using the Indigenous Map Overlays
description: A step-by-step lesson plan to using the Indigenous Map Overlays.

files.title: Where is my Home? Using the Indigenous Map Layers

learningOutcomes: Students will locate their home, school and community on the satellite imagery using the Indigenous map layers, see their location in relation to treaty area, indigenous territory, traditional languages, reserves and settlements, metis regions, residential school locations
compare sizes of indigenous territories to reserves and settlements

title: Exploring Collective Rights Using the Indigenous Voices Module in Alberta Tomorrow
description: A lesson plan where students learn about Indigenous Rights and Treaty 7, and explore the geography of Indigenous peoples in Alberta through the Alberta Tomorrow Indigenous Voices Module.

files.title: Exploring Collective Rights Document

tags: Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
learningOutcomes: Students will explore the geography of Indigenous peoples in Alberta and learn about the relationship between the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms and Indigenous Rights.
Students will critically assess how collective rights have impacted Indigenous communities and whether treaty rights are being honored.

title: Yesterday, Today, and Tomorrow: Using the Alberta Tomorrow Simulator
description: Students will see how the landscape has changed since 1900 as a result of human activity. They will then investigate a business-as-usual future based on past development rates.

files.title: Yesterday, Today and Tomorrow - Using the Alberta Tomorrow Simulator

learningOutcomes: Explore the province of Alberta on satellite imagery
Identify which watershed they live in
See how the landscape has changed and the effect on environmental indicators
Explore a projected 'business as usual' scenario

title: My Future Alberta: Creating a Landuse Plan for 2050
description: Students use the Alberta Tomorrow simulator to create a land use plan for Albertaâ€™s future.

files.title: My Future Alberta: Creating a Landuse Plan for 2050

learningOutcomes: Create a landuse plan for Albertaâ€™s future

title: How do our Landuse Decisions affect the Biogeochemicals and Cycling of Matter in our Ecosystem?
description: Students explore the water, carbon, nitrogen, and phosphorus cycles and how landuse disrupts them. They use the simulator to explore scenarios and develop mitigation strategies.

files.title: Bio 20 Lesson Plan
Bio 20 Student Worksheet
Bio 20 Answer Key

learningOutcomes: Define biogeochemical cycles
Investigate nutrient cycles and disruptions
Explore scenarios using the simulator
Develop a sustainable landuse plan

title: Governments Have it Rough! Can You Make Everyone Happy?
description: Students assume the role of government planners tasked with balancing the interests of various stakeholders in land-use decisions. Through the simulator, they explore the complexities of policy-making and the challenges of satisfying diverse community needs.

files.title: Governments Have it Rough!

learningOutcomes: Students will learn about the interaction between the economy and environmental indicators
students will investigate multiple perspectives on appropirate land use
Students will role play different stakeholders
Students will develop a landuse plan that would be best for all Albertans

title: Did We Do That? A Study of Alberta's Geography and the Benefits and Drawbacks of Landuse
description: Grade 4 students will investigate Alberta's natural ecoregions through a series of educational videos, examining the benefits and drawbacks of different land-use decisions.

files.title: Grade 4 Lesson Plan

learningOutcomes: Investigate the geography of Alberta
Examine the benefits and drawbacks of land-use practices

title: Did I Do That? The Relationship Between Humans and Their Environment
description: Using the Alberta Tomorrow simulator, students investigate the unintended consequences of human activity on the environment. They are challenged to come up with a future landuse plan for their watershed that balances the economy with the environment.

files.title: Science 7 Lesson Plan

learningOutcomes: Investigate past changes on the landscape
Investigate a possible future
Create their own landuse plan for the future

title: Landuse Field Trip
description: This is a self-led guide for teachers to go on a field trip with their class that investigates at least 2 different areas: one more pristine and one affected by landuse (e.g., a city, golf course). The lesson includes student worksheets and water test procedures. Users must supply their own test kits.
approximateTime: 1/2 day - full day depending on travel time

files.title: Land Use Field Trip

tags: Investigating Matter and Enschange in the Biosphere
Investigating Matter and Energy in the Environment
learningOutcomes: Investigate and compare water quality in a relatively pristine area and compare to one that has been affected by landuse

title: Stakeholder Debate
description: In this stakeholder debate, the class is divided into different stakeholder groups. Each group must create a landuse plan that achieves their goals as a company or organization. They present their proposals to the class or government, and in the end, a consensus landuse plan that meets the goals of society is decided upon.

files.title: Stakeholder Debate Lesson Plan

tags: Energy and Matter in Chemical Change
Energy and Matter Exchange in the Biosphere
learningOutcomes: Students will learn about the interaction between the economy and environmental indicators
Students will investigate multiple perspectives on appropriate land use
Students will role play different stakeholders
Students will develop a landuse plan that would be best for all Albertans

title: Mistakes, Mitigations, and Making Amends. A Webinar by CPAWS and Alberta Tomorrow
description: A land based learning webinar presented by Alberta Tomorrow and CPAWS Southern Alberta.

files.title: Land Based Learning Webinar Worksheet

title: Isotopes and Climate Change
description: We can track climate changes by looking at what types of isotopes are in the water.

files.title: Isotopes and Climate Change - Google Doc

learningOutcomes: Examine the use of isotope tracking
Investigate the consequences of climate change
Examine the negative impact of climate change

title: Glenmore Dam and Reservoir: Water Services
description: In this activity you will learn about the movement and management of water within the city of Calgary, along with the history of the Glenmore Resevoir and Dam.

files.title: Glenmore Dam and Resevoir: Water Services - Google Doc

title: Water Quality: Water Treatment
description: In this activity you will learn about the process of cleaning water to meet drinking standards within the City of Calgary.

files.title: Water Quality: Water Treatment - Google Doc

learningOutcomes: Investigate the stages of water treatment

title: Constructed Wetlands and Stormwater
description: In this activity you will learn about stormwater and how wetlands are constructed to manage it.

files.title: Constructed Wetlands and Stormwater - Google Doc

learningOutcomes: Examine stormwater functions and the role of wetlands in water management and quality
Investigate the consequences of resource production, urbanization, and economic growth on wetlands and water quality
Examine the negative environmental impact of disruption of the watershed as a result of resource use

title: Aquifers
description: In this activity you will learn about the aquifer and groundwater within the Elbow River sub basin.

files.title: Aquifers - Google Doc

learningOutcomes: Examine the landscape and compare them to what the geology below could look like
Investigate the consequences of resource production, urbanization, and economic growth on aquifers and groundwater

title: The Watershed
description: In this activity you will learn about how land use changes impact how water moves through the landscape and how that changes our interactions with it.

files.title: The Watershed - Google Doc

learningOutcomes: Examine the land and spaces where water exists
Investigate the different ways that people can interact with the rivers and water
Examine the need for water in our lives

title: Hydrology and Land Development
description: In this activity you will learn about how land use changes impact how water moves through the landscape and how that changes our interactions with it.

files.title: Hydrology and Land Development - Google Doc

learningOutcomes: Examine the watershed and hydrological practices
Investigate how a watershed functions

title: Watersheds and Hydrology
description: In this activity you will learn about the basic functions of a watershed, and the hydrology that is involved.

files.title: Watersheds and Hydrology - Google Doc

learningOutcomes: Examine the stage of the watershed
Investigate watershed functions

title: Hydrology and Climate Change
description: In this activity you will learn about how to monitor climate change and hydrologic functions within a watershed.

files.title: Hydrology and Climate Change - Google Doc

learningOutcomes: Examine the effects of climate change on the water cycle and hydrology

title: Invasive Species and Control
description: In this activity you will learn about invasive species found in Alberta, along with methods to control them.

files.title: Invasive Species and Control - Google Doc

learningOutcomes: Examine the role of invasive, introduced and threatened species
Investigate the methods of addressing the management of invasive species
Observe spaces that native and introduced species are seen to examine the role of biodiversity

title: Native Prairies and Plants
description: In this activity, you will learn about the biodiversity of the native prairies, and the many different types of functions native plants have roles in, as well as the importance of bees and other pollinators.

files.title: Native Prairies and Plants - Google Doc

learningOutcomes: Examine the ecological roles of plants in the prairies
Investigate the methods of addressing threatened native species
Observe spaces that native and introduced species are seen to examine the role of biodiversity
